parameters 0.1.0

  • Articles
    • Bayesian GAM Models
    • Single vs. Bootstrapped Parameters

Bayesian Models Parameters

model_parameters.stanreg.Rd

Parameters of Bayesian models.

# S3 method for stanreg
model_parameters(model, ci = 0.9,
  standardize = FALSE, estimate = "median", test = c("pd", "rope"),
  rope_bounds = "default", rope_full = TRUE, diagnostic = TRUE,
  priors = TRUE, iterations = 1000, ...)

Arguments

model

Bayesian model.
ci

Credible Interval (CI) level. Default to 0.90 (90%).
standardize

Add standardized parameters. Default to FALSE as this re-fits the model and can thus take some time.
estimate

The point-estimate(s) to compute. Can be a character or a list with "median", "mean" or "MAP".
test

What indices of effect existence to compute. Can be a character or a list with "p_direction", "rope" or "p_map".
rope_bounds

ROPE's lower and higher bounds. Should be a list of two values (e.g., c(-0.1, 0.1)) or "default". If "default", the bounds are set to x +- 0.1*SD(response).
rope_full

If TRUE, use the proportion of the entire posterior distribution for the equivalence test. Otherwise, use the proportion of HDI as indicated by the ci argument.
diagnostic

Include sampling diagnostic metrics (effective sample, Rhat and MCSE). Effective Sample should be as large as possible, altough for most applications, an effective sample size greater than 1,000 is sufficient for stable estimates (Bürkner, 2017). Rhat should not be larger than 1.1.
priors

Include priors specifications information. If set to true (current rstanarm' default), automatically adjusted priors' scale during fitting will be displayed.
iterations

The number of bootstrap replicates. This only apply in the case of bootsrapped frequentist models.
...

Arguments passed to or from other methods (e.g., to standardize).

References

  • Comparison of Point-Estimates

  • Comparison of Indices of Effect Existence

Examples

# NOT RUN {
library(rstanarm)
model <- rstanarm::stan_glm(mpg ~ wt + cyl, data = mtcars)
model_parameters(model)

library(brms)
model <- brms::brm(mpg ~ wt + cyl, data = mtcars)
model_parameters(model)
# }
